name: Easy Slow Cooker Cheesy Potato Soup with Ham
author: fabeveryday
summary: This rich, thick, and creamy soup is a great way to use up leftover holiday ham! Made in your slow cooker, and using shortcuts like frozen hash brown potatoes, this delicious soup requires very little effort on your part.
ingredients: 1 (28 ounce) package frozen hash brown potatoes, thawed
2 tablespoons chopped green onions, or to taste
directions: Combine hash browns, ham, onion, celery, chicken broth, salt, pepper, and garlic powder in a slow cooker
Place the lid on the slow cooker
Cook on Low heat until celery is soft, 4 to 5 hours
Mix in cream cheese and Cheddar cheese
Cover and cook on Low for an additional 30 minutes, stirring occasionally
Serve topped with chopped green onions as a garnish
